title: John Updike - Novels, Short Stories, Essays, Poems (34 books)
description:
JOHN UPDIKE (1932-2009) was an American novelist, poet, short story writer, art critic, and literary critic, widely considered to be one of the great American writers of his time.  He is one of only three authors to win the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction more than once.  Updike published more than twenty novels and more than a dozen short story collections, as well as poetry, art criticism, and literary criticism, all of which are represented in this collection.


Unless otherwise indicated, the following books are in EPUB format:

* THE AFTERLIFE & OTHER STORIES (Knopf, 1994)

* ALWAYS LOOKING: Essays on Art (Knopf, 2012)

* BECH: A BOOK (Knopf, 1970)

* BECH AT BAY  (Knopf, 1998)

* BECH IS BACK (Knopf, 1982)

* BRAZIL (Knopf, 1994)

* THE CARPENTERED HEN & OTHER TAME CREATURES (Knopf, 1982)

* THE CENTAUR (Knopf, 1963)

* THE COUP (Knopf, 1978)

* COUPLES (Knopf, 1968) -- PDF

* DUE CONSIDERATIONS: Essays and Criticism (Knopf, 2007)

* EARLY STORIES, 1953-1975 (Knopf, 2003) -- EPUB + PDF

* HIGHER GOSSIP: Essays and Criticism (Knopf, 2011)

* IN THE BEAUTY OF THE LILIES (Knopf, 1996)

* THE MAPLES STORIES (Knopf, 2009)

* MARRY ME: A Romance (Penguin, 1977)

* MORE MATTER: Essays and Criticism (Knopf, 2000)

* THE MUSIC SCHOOL (Knopf, 1966)

* MY FATHER'S TEARS & OTHER STORIES (Penguin, 2009)

* OF THE FARM (Knopf, 1965) -- PDF

* PIGEON FEATHERS & OTHERS STORIES (Knopf, 1962)

* THE POORHOUSE FAIR (Knopf, 1959)

* RABBIT AT REST (Knopf, 1990)

* RABBIT IS RICH (Knopf, 1981)

* RABBIT REDUX (Knopf, 1971)

* RABBIT, RUN (Knopf, 1960)

* RICH IN RUSSIA (Penguin, 1970)

* S. (Knopf, 1988)

* SEEK MY FACE (Knopf, 2002)

* SELF-CONSCIOUSNESS: Memoirs (Knopf, 1989) -- PDF

* TERRORIST (Knopf, 2006)

* TOWARD THE END OF TIME (Knopf, 1997)

* THE WIDOWS OF EASTWICK (Knopf, 2008)

* THE WITCHES OF EASTWICK (Knopf, 1984)
